columns.text: In this exercise, we will determine the effective semiannual rate, quarterly and monthly, if the effective annual rate of the investment is 11.6%.

Let's discuss what an annual percentage rate is.

The Effective Annual Rate refers to a loan's annual interest rate after considering the nominal interest and the compounding period.

Since the effective rate considers the nominal rate, we will first calculate the nominal rate of the investment based on the effective annual rate and the various period as required by the calculation.

In calculating the nominal rate of the investment, we will use the APR formula.

APR, the *Annual Percentage Rate* also referred to as the stated rate, is calculated by multiplying the nominal rate by the number of periods in a year, representing the annual rate a lender can quote its customer as prescribed by laws.

The APR formula can be computed using the as follows equation:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{APR} &=m\times\left(\left(1+EAR\right)^{\dfrac{1}{m}}-1\right)
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$EAR$, which means the effective annual rate\
$APR$, which refers to the annual percentage rate\
$m$, which refers to the period

Let's now determine the semiannual rate of the investment. We will consider the following details:

| Particulars           |       |
|-----------------------|-------|
| Effective annual rate | 11.6% |
| Period                | 2     |

Note that the period is two since semiannual means six months, and there are only two in a year.

First, we will calculate the nominal rate by using the APR equation.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{APR} &=2\times\left(\left(1+0.1160\right)^{\dfrac{1}{2}}-1\right)
\\[10pt]
&=2\times0.056409012
\\[5pt]
&= \boxed{11.28\%}
\end{aligned}$$

As can be seen in the above calculation, the nominal rate is 11.28%

Next, we will divide the nominal rate by the number of periods to determine the effective semiannual rate. We will consider the following equation:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Effective Semiannual Rate} &=\dfrac{APR}{\text{m}}
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$APR$, which indicates the nominal rate\
$m$, which present period

Next, using the same equations and applications, let's calculate the effective quarterly rate considering the following details:

| Particulars           |       |
|-----------------------|-------|
| Effective annual rate | 11.6% |
| Period                | 4     |

Note that the period is four since a quarter is consist of three months, and there are four in a year.

Let's compute the nominal rate using the APR formula.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{APR} &=4\times\left(\left(1+0.1160\right)^{\dfrac{1}{4}}-1\right)
\\[10pt]
&=4\times0.027817597
\\[5pt]
&= \boxed{11.13\%}
\end{aligned}$$

Therefore, the nominal rate for the effective quarterly rate of the investment is 11.13.

Last, let's determine the effective monthly rate of the investment. We will use the following details in our calculation:

| Particulars           |       |
|-----------------------|-------|
| Effective annual rate | 11.6% |
| Period                | 12    |

Note that the period is twelve as a year is composed of twelve months.

Let's now calculate the nominal rate using the APR functional.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{APR} &=12\times\left(\left(1+0.1160\right)^{\dfrac{1}{12}}-1\right)
\\[10pt]
&=12\times0.009187857
\\[5pt]
&= \boxed{11.03\%}
\end{aligned}$$

Hence, the nominal rate for the effective monthly rate of the investment is 11.03%.

To conclude, the effective rate of the investment at different period are as follows:

| **Period**     | **Rate**  |
|------------|-------|
| Semiannual | 5.64% |
| Quartely   | 2.78% |
| Monthly    | 0.92% |
